title: Bounds of a Logarithm
text: Since $$\log_{2}\left(\frac{1+2x}{x+3}\right)$$ cannot be negative or zero, then $$\frac{1+2x}{x+3}>0$$.

title: When is a Fraction Positive?

title: When is a Fraction Positive?
text: For some values a,b where $$b$$ $$ \neq 0$$, the fraction $$\frac{a}{b}$$ is positive when (a>0 AND b>0) OR (a<0 AND b<0).
speech: For some values a,b where  b   is not equal to, 0 , the fraction  a over b  is positive when (a>0 AND b>0) OR (a<0 AND b<0).

title: When is a Fraction Positive?
text: The fraction $$\frac{1+2x}{x+3}$$ is positive when (1+2*x>0 AND x+3>0) OR (1+2*x<0 AND x+3<0).
speech: The fraction  fraction, 1 plus 2 x, over, x plus 3,   is positive when (1+2*x>0 AND x+3>0) OR (1+2*x<0 AND x+3<0).
